intro: Pauridia monticola subsp. nubigena, commonly known as the cloud mountain pauridia, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the branches. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
